title: Chapter 88 - Di-di-di, Calling Transport
body:
Chapter 88 - Di-di-di, Calling Transport


“Bai Yi, are you sure?” Yao Si asked while downing the entire bowl in one gulp.


Bai Yi nodded vigorously. He couldn’t seem to get use to her new identity, for he kept scratching his head as he passed her the map. “Pres- Your Highness, it’s right here, close to where we are.”


Yao Si glanced over, and there was indeed a flashing red dot on the map, below which was the distance: 5.8 km.


The service crew mentioned that there would occasionally be special gifts available in the third district for beginners. The gifts would be able to increase their mental strength more effectively, but that was dependant on the individual, and the chance of an encounter was rare. Besides, the individual would be put under a considerable amount of risk during it, so Yao Si didn’t hold much hope.


But somehow, her luck was way over the charts – she actually spotted it!


“Great, let’s hurry over.” Yao Si turned, prepared to head over. This was practically a gift from heavens, so she wouldn’t miss it for the world.


“Wait a minute, Your Highness.” Gu Shucheng stopped her yet again. “Even though its just 5.8 km, this is a jungle. If you were to run there, it’d take about an hour which might not be fast enough, why don’t we fly then?”


Yao Si stilled. “You brought flying devices?” Didn’t the rules mention that the only non-celestial item allowed was the optical computer?


“No.” Gu Shucheng shook his head. “In order to deal with such situations, the celestials’ have prepared simple transportation tools for those on training.” Gu Shucheng tapped his optical computer, signaling for her to open the beginner guide.


There are such services? If I’d known, I wouldn’t have hopped onto that unlucky Zan Zichen’s free ride!


Yao Si opened the guide with joy, and inside, there was indeed a ‘call for transport’ option. She hurriedly tapped onto it, and a purple gleam shot out from the optical computer into the skies.


What kind of transport will it be ? Yao Si waited, preparing for a flying sword or a ship to appear.


Suddenly, bird cry came from above. Upon rising her head, Yao saw five celestial swans flying over from afar!


“…”


○|￣|_


It was indeed the transportation used by the celestials!


The option she had pressed a moment ago was… calling for swans?


-_-|||


Maybe due to the tip given, the celestial swans flew much faster than before. In less than five minutes, they were at their destination. After paying the swans, they found themselves in front of a cave.


“The level up gift is inside?”


“You’re right, this is the marking on the map,” Bai Yi replied.


Yao Si looked in front of them, which was clearly a horrifying cave. Biting down on her lip, she decided to go for it!


“I’m going in.”


“Go for it, Your Highness!” The group of bloodlings made a fist to show their support, with only Gu Shucheng looking regretful. “Your Highness, are you sure you don’t want us to follow along? What if you meet with danger…” He frowned, adding seriously, “We would really love to witness your prowess and cheer you on!”


“…” Cheer me on? I’m sure you just want to watch a show. “It’s fine, I’ll be training my mental strength not my ability, so your presence will distract me.”


They glanced at each other before nodding regretfully. “We’ll wait for your successful return.”


“Yes, you don’t have to worry about us, bash what is there up!”


“Oh right, meal time is in six hours, Your Highness, remember…”


“I know, I know.” Yao Si waved her hand in annoyance. Isn’t it just a meal? Is there a need to repeat it so many times! Without hesitation, she headed into the cave.
